segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden is so peaceful, and the path looks so inviting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, it’s pure chaos with the water and the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the mom ever looks up from her dishes to see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the outside and inside is almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the mom because she’s missing everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are taking advantage of her distraction, and it’s only a matter of time before something goes wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she at least enjoys the view while she’s working.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden looks so well-kept, but the kitchen is a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’d rather be outside than dealing with this chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just so ironic.
segments.speaker: PAR
